dns_goals.1-title: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
dns_goals.10-title: Reduce inequality within and among countries
dns_goals.11-title: Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable
dns_goals.12-title: Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns
dns_goals.13-title: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts
dns_goals.14-title: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
dns_goals.15-title: Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
dns_goals.16-title: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
dns_goals.17-title: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalise the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
dns_goals.2-title: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
dns_goals.3-title: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
dns_goals.4-title: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
dns_goals.5-title: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
dns_goals.6-title: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
dns_goals.7-title: Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all
dns_goals.8-title: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
dns_goals.9-title: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialisation and foster innovation

dns_ranges.17.2-title: Knowledge transfer, especially in technical areas

dns_targets.10.1.1-title: Improving educational success of foreigners in German schools
dns_targets.12.1.1-title: Making consumption environmentally and socially compatible
dns_targets.12.2.1-title: Increasing the proportion of sustainable production continuously
dns_targets.12.3.1-title: Giving shape to the public sector’s exemplary role in sustainable procurement
dns_targets.13.1.2-title: Germany’s contribution to international climate finance
dns_targets.14.1.1-title: Protecting and sustainably using oceans and marine resources
dns_targets.15.2.1-title: Protecting ecosystems, conserving ecosystem services and preserving habitats
dns_targets.16.2.1-title: Taking practical action to combat proliferation, especially of small arms
dns_targets.17.3.1-title: Improving trade opportunities for developing countries
dns_targets.2.1.1-title: Environmentally sound production in our cultivated landscapes
dns_targets.2.2.1-title: Realising globally the right to food
dns_targets.4.1.1-title: Continuously improving education and vocational training
dns_targets.4.2.1-title: Improving the compatibility of work and family life
dns_targets.5.1.2-title: Strengthening the economic participation of women globally
dns_targets.6.1.1-title: Reducing the pollution of water with substances
dns_targets.6.2.1-title: Better access to drinking water and sanitation worldwide, higher (safer) quality sanitation worldwide, higher (safer) quality
dns_targets.8.2.1-title: Consolidating public finances – Creating intergenerational equity
dns_targets.8.3.1-title: Creating favourable investment conditions – Securing long-term prosperity
dns_targets.8.4.1-title: Combining greater economic output with environmental and social responsibility
dns_targets.9.1.1-title: Shaping the future with new solutions

frontpage.heading: Indicators of the German Sustainable Development Strategy
frontpage.instructions: Click on each goal, for German statistics for Sustainable Development Goal indicators.
frontpage.instructions_dns: Click on each goal, or %before_link search %after_link for the German Sustainable Development Strategy indicator data.
frontpage.joint_action_text: The Federal Statistical Office is part of the Joint Action for Sustainable Development, an open platform for all those who are committed to a sustainable society.
frontpage.link_18_title: Click here to get to the DESTATIS page about the German Sustainable Development Strategy
frontpage.strategy_text: Information on the "German Sustainable Development Strategy" can be found here.

header.additional_information_blurb: The time series below consists of ranges of numbers instead of individual values. For technical reasons, the presentation in the form of interactive charts and tables is only possible for time series with purely numerical values, therefore the time series is presented here in PDF format.
header.data_not_available: No data available for this selection of sub-categories and units
header.dataset_size_warning: There are too many datasets to show on the chart. Not all will be shown until you remove some selections.
header.dns_metadata_blurb: This table includes additional information to the above visualized indicators, <abbr title="that is to say (id est)">i.e.</abbr> a short definition of this indicator and a description of the politically determined target values as well as explaining the political intention behind selecting this indicator.
header.global_metadata_blurb: This table provides information on metadata for SDG indicators. Global metadata is provided by the UN Statistics Division.
header.history_blurb: The synoptic table provides information about the evaluation of the indicator in previous years. It shows if the weather symbol assigned to an indicator was rather stable or volatile in the past years. (Evaluation of the Indicator Report 2022 )
header.legend_help: Click on the legend to remove individual lines from the chart.
header.national_metadata_blurb:
The international organisations (custodian agencies) that are responsible for the respective SDG-indicator publish methodological guidelines for the calculation of the indicator - so-called global metadata.

Displayed here are the national time series that fit the global metadata best as well as their comparability to the global metadata. Please find further methodical and country-specific information of the time series in the related national metadata sheet.
header.no_data_hint: No options available because of filters above
header.no_selection: No disaggregations are available for this indicator
header.series_help: Select here what should be displayed in the chart and in the table.
header.series_help_dns: Select here what should be displayed in the chart and in the table.
header.special_eval: Special evaluation based on data from the following
header.special_eval_plural: Special evaluation based on data from the following

paststatuses.2-2-a_1_target: Funds disbursed for the application of the guidelines and recommendations of the UN Committee on World Food Security (CFS) to be increased appropriately as a percentage of total spending on food security by 2030

paststatuses.7-1-ab_2_target: Reduction by 20% by 2020, by 30% by 2030, and by 50% by 2050, all compared to 2008

paststatuses.7-2-b_1_target: Increase to at least 35% by 2020, 65% by 2030, and greenhouse gas neutrality of electricity generated and consumed in Germa-ny by 2050

paststatuses.8-3-a_1: 8.3 - Gross fixed capital formation in relation to GDP
paststatuses.8-3-a_1_target: Appropriate development of the ratio, to be maintained until 2030

paststatuses.9-1-a_1_target: At least 3.5% of GDP per year by 2025

post.view_all_in_category: View all posts in the %category_name category

status.blitz: The indicator is not moving in the right direction so that the gap to the target value is widening
status.leicht bew\u00f6lkt: If the trend continues, the indicator will be presumably miss its target by at least 5 % and at most 20&nbsp% of the difference between the target value and the current value
status.sonne: If the trend continues, the target value will be met or the difference between the target value and the current value will be less than 5 %
status.wolke: The indicator is moving in the right direction but if the trend continues, the target value will be missed by more than 20 % in the target year

weather.assessment_later: Assessment will be carried out later
weather.overview_blurb:
In the overview table, the ratings of the indicators are given according to the status of the previous years. This shows whether the weather symbol for an indicator has been stable or rather volatile in the past years.
The basis for the assessments presented here is the data as published in the 2022 indicator report. The data on this platform is updated regularly, so that more current data may be available online than published in the indicator report.

Indicators with multiple targets
For indicators with multiple targets to be met over time (e.g., indicator 7.1.b), the ratings for meeting each target are provided. The same applies to indicators with multiple targets to be met simultaneously (e.g., indicator 10.1).

Indicators with target changes
In addition to the currently valid goals of the federal government, the goals are presented that were valid in the past but have been changed in the meantime.

In grayed out form, all weather icons are displayed for destinations that are currently not valid, because
• the target has been changed in the past,
• a goal closer in time must be fulfilled first, or
• the target is only one of several targets to be fulfilled at the same time.
